sections.MISSION: Bull Troop conducts M2/MK19 range, practice qualification and qualification at RG 109 on 28-29NOV23 IOT maintain a high level of readiness with individual weapons proficiency
sections.PURPOSE: Ensure Bull Troop SMs are fundamentally sound on all levels on marksmanship with the M2 and MK19 weapon systems IOT prepare for upcoming training events and maintain lethality within Bull Troop.
sections.KEY TASKS:
–
Recon the site
Make POC with firers from other Troops
Conduct PMI for .50 Cal and MK19 before training
Qualify firers on their weapon system
sections.EXECUTION:
Safeties, beach masters, and all range personnel will be certified on 22NOV23. Firers will conduct PMI and familiarization/skills classes prior to qualifying on 27 November23. Firers execute qualification at RG 109 on 28-29NOV23 for .50 Cal and MK19. Tower will organize targets with Range Detail.
Endstate: All designated SMs qualified on M2 and MK19.
sections.SUSTAINMENT:
CL I- MRE for lunch
CL III- Top of fuel prior to SP
CL IV- N/A
CL V- Draw at range, request 280800NOV23 drop off, 290930NOV23 pick up
CL VIII – Individual IFACs and CLS for medic
CL X- Provided by Range Control via TSR
sections.COORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
-
Each BTRP PLT will provide a safety and two crews for each weapon system.
3/Bull will provide OIC, RSO, medic and ammo point detail.
Each PLT/Section will stage all vehicles and equipment at the motor pool prior to SP.
Each Troop will provide one crew for each weapon system.
M2/MK19 RANGE CONOP 28-29NOV 23

draw.mission_task_and_description: BULL TROOP, 1st SQDN, 2CR SQUADRON M2and MK19 Qualification

subtask.name: Execution of .50 cal and MK19 Qualification

values: Soldiers will maintain muzzle awareness and will clear their weapons prior to exiting the range.
Weapons will be kept in the proper weapon control status determined by unit leadership
SDZs will be planned in coordination with 7th ATC safety.
Personnel will load weapons on firing line
Safeties will control target presentation.
When necessary, roads will be closed IAW HN Regulations.
During night live fires, Soldiers will use PEQ-15s when engaging targets.
Leaders will identify targets and mark left and right limits of sectors of fire with weapon mounted lasers.
Firers will positively identify all targets prior to engaging.
-Safeties will step in to control individuals when necessary -Range Safety brief from RSO
-OIC -RSO -Individuals -Safeties

subtask.name: Execution of .50 cal and MK19 Qualification

values: Firers will only fire at positively identified targets.
Individual will move selector switch to SAFE before conducting any movement.
Weapon control status is Tight.
Misfire procedures will be reinforced during the Safety brief.
Functions check will be conducted prior to firing of all weapons.
Dunnage pit identified.
-AR/DA PAM 385-63 -Safety Briefing -Leader Supervision -Individual Soldier Discipline
-OIC -RSO -Individuals -Safeties

Soldiers will adhere to all instructions given by Tower, RSO, and safeties, and only engage targets presented in scenario inside of range fans.

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Separate incompatible lots/types of ammunition and explosives.
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after every iteration to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified by QASAS.
Ammunition NCO and Ammunition Detail, OIC

subtasks.hazard: Tactical Vehicle maneuvering IVO of Dismounts Vehicle

values: Soldiers will adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA according to GTA SOP.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
All Soldiers inside of a tactical vehicle will either be seated in a designated seating platform wearing a seatbelt, or standing with a restraint harness.
No crews will be outside of vehicles while firing or maneuvering.
Leaders understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
Tactical Vehicles will use a ground guide when maneuvering within 10 meters of dismounts.
ICV-Ds will have a minimum of 4x personnel while operating on GTA. VC will wear slick Modular Scalable Vests.
ICV-D TCs will be an NCO or Officer.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, RSO, Safeties, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous road conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, slippery roads, etc)

values: Vehicles adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA according to GTA SOP.
Vehicles will reduce to speeds IOT allow safe operation of vehicle through terrain.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC. RSO, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Loss of Communication with Range Control

values: If communication with Range Control is lost, Range will immediately cease fire until communication can be returned with Range Control.
DSN, Cell Phone, FM, and Staff Duty will be used to regain communication with Range Control
CONOP, Safety/Range Brief
OIC, RSO, NCOIC, Leadership

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, falls & other misc. injuries

values: Soldiers will execute Qualification in Full Dragoon Standard.
Soldiers climbing on top of tactical vehicles wear a helmet and maintain 3-points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
OIC/RSO understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
A designated vehicle will be marked properly for CASEVAC/MEDEVAC at the range tower.
Driver and Medic/CLS certified person will be briefed on routes, and strip maps with coordinates of AXP stored in vehicle.
Medic will carry medic certification paperwork at all times.
Driver and Medic will remain with MEDEVAC Vehicle at all times
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Rehearsals
Lane OIC/NCOIC, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Improper Use of Weapons Systems and Lasers

values: All weapons will remain oriented in a safe direction.
All Soldiers demonstrate laser proficiency
Lasers will only be used while engaging targets.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC/NCOIC, Team Leaders, Soldiers
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and during training period IAW WE SOP.
All issued sensitive items tied down IAW SOP.
Sensitive items inventory conducted IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.
Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, SOPs, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Soldiers
Range will cease fire if wildlife is on the range or if a fire erupts on the training range and will not go wet until all wildlife/fire has been cleared from range.
Any Soldier that spots wildlife or a fire will call the range to cease fire.
In the case of fire, range control will be called when prompted by the range meister to keep them abreast of the situation.
Fire fighting detail will remain ready with all PPE in the case that they must be deployed to retard fire.
Safety/Range Brief
All Soldiers
